About the Authors: This game was made by two SFU students, namely, the bearded man Paul Allan, and the small man Kenney Wu. The game was developed for our CMPT276 class, taught by Professor Brian Fraser. More information about the class can be found at http://www.cs.sfu.ca/CourseCentral/276/bfraser/index.html.

About the Game (Really): In this game, your task is to locate every bomb in the minefield. When you begin the game, you will see a grid of possible search locations. When you select an empty location, there are two possible outcomes. If there is no bomb in the selected location, a scan result will appear. The scan result tells you how many bombs are in the same row or column, as the location you searched. If there is a bomb, the bomb will be revealed. If you decide to search the location of a revealed bomb, a scan result will appear. Every time a scan result or bomb is revealed it will count as an action. Try to win in as few actions as possible!
